Comment: People really misunderstand this part of jury selection. Folks are not barred from the jury process simply because they have an opinion on things or know about the situation. Complete and total ignorance of anything related to the case is obviously an unreasonable standard for certain cases, and even then, do you REALLY think finding the 12 most living-under-a-rock people automatically results in better outcomes? Jurors that can think and are invested in society are a good thing.  So the standard here isn't "are you completely oblivious?" but rather "can you be impartial as you apply the facts and the law in this case regardless of what you know or suspect about this case?" There are plenty of folks in the latter category who could serve as a jury.
